(calling after) Bring us leftovers!

(calling back) Pay your rent! We DISSOLVE from the TV, BACK TO THE STUDIO Jules whips open her skirt and uses it as a Pasa Doble ca Evan grabs the skirt and throws it to the JUDGES’ TABLE. audience eats it up. As we -

PULL OUT FROM THE TV of a THIRD LIVING ROOM (a modest ren house) where HOLLY BOWEN (Caucasian, more creative than corporate) is on the couch with her LAPTOP as her husband NATE BOWEN (30, African-American, total guy’s guy) takes step into the living room -
What are you watching?
Celebrity Dance -
- Nope. - And exits the hell outta there. Holly laughs, CRANKS TH VOLUME to torture Nate as he walks away. And we -
Where Evan spins Jules in a final, harrowing lift, then d her into a split as the music ends with a dramatic punch. THE AUDIENCE JUMPS UP, a STANDING OVATION. Jules and Evan hug, soaking up the love.

Whoa. Even I need a cold shower after that one. I dunno, folks, did Tom Brady just get sacked? Let’s see what our judges have to say. Hutch turns Jules and Evan to the JUDGE’S TABLE, where a DANCE EXPERTS weigh in.  ANDRE (30s , a hyperbolic queen who can barely stay in his seat) starts off -

Jules, darling. When you started this season, you had the heart of a competitor, but the feet of a school girl in need of corrective shoes. I never expected to see you in the finals. But you stubborn little minx, you. You fought for it, and tonight, you were a vixen, making a meal out of your man out there! This place needs a new roof - because you two just blew it off! Two words: Dance. Gasm! Everyone cheers as the next judge, KELLY (30s), nods.

Exactly! Jules, on your show, you inspire people to lose weight and change their lives. But it’s just as inspiring to see you challenge yourself. And it doesn’t hurt that you met your match in Evan there. (Jules and Evan smile) You two are peaking at just the right moment! More cheers as the final judge, DALTON (60s, stuffy) shru

holds up his score card ip

A TROPHY in shape of dancing feet gets ceremoniously lowe onto the dance floor. All three finalist couples hold hands under their spotlig Tom Brady and his girl. Missy and her guy. Jules and Evan

Hey. Great stuff out there.
Thanks. You too. Nice flip. Tom shrugs - I try. As Jules turns and whispers to Evan -
C'mon. He’s already got three Superbowl Rings and Gisele. Isn’t that enough for one lifetime?
Just Gisele is enough.
And the winner of Celebrity Dance Off, Season 15, is... A dramatic pause. Jules suddenly goes pale. Panic-whisper
Evan. I feel sick!

..-Jules Baxter and Evan Webb!  ‘Ee FIREWORKS exploded around the stage and the audience chee Evan grabs Jules, picks her up and spins her around as he fellow contestants congratulate them - Jules's POV - a woozy blur of lights and cheering people. (then, a nervous laugh) Heh-heh. Hope she’s not pregnant. Jules and Evan suddenly share a surprised, but knowing lo Sheer panic in both their eyes. And we CUT TO BLACK. TITLE: WHAT TO EXPECT WHEN YOU'RE EXPECTING.

FLASH! A CAMERA takes a photo of Trish (one half of our Snuggie couple). She’s tidy, always with a nervous smile. The photographer (the other half of our Snuggie couple) i her husband, Colin, rocking khakis and a polo.

Hi everyone! Trish sits before a small assembly of TODDLERS, holding h children’s book: Milk It! There are a few BREAST-FEEDING MOMS, a couple of RELUCTANT DADS. Discreetly checking fan scores on their phones. Signage tells us we’re in a store: THE BREAST CHOICE - a mecca of breast-feeding classes and supplies. TRISH (CONT’D) Welcome to the Breast Choice. I’m Trish Cooper, wearing two hats today as store owner and author of my new children’s book, “Milk It!” (Trish opens the book.) OK, so, let’s dig in... (reading) Goats do it... An illustration shows a GOAT NURSING. She turns the page.  TRISH (CONT’D) Cows do it... (turns the page) Kitty cats do it. (turns the page) Even dolphins in the sea do it. A TODDLER BOY lays down, kicks his legs on the floor. TRISH (CONT’D) Animals all over the world do it. (turns the page) And yes: even YOUR mommy does it When your mommy uses her breast to feed a baby, she is feeding her baby the best. Breast is BEST! A caffeinated TEENAGE BOY pops his head into the store -
- And tears off, laughing. Trish gives a pleading look to Colin who haltingly TAKES OFF after him, out of the store
(beat, smile) OK, I’d like to open up the floor for questions or comments or... Nothing. Finally -
Are Shrek and The Hulk brothers?

(pauses, smiles) Maybe. We’re all related in some way, right? (again, nothing) Well, thanks everyone for coming. And give your mommy a big hug for breast-feeding you. You now have a head start on a very healthy life! Colin re-enters the store and joins Trish as the reading breaks up. He gives her a peck on the forehead.
Great job, Hon —
- Did you get him?  10 ll
Naw. Too fast. But I yelled a few choice words. Very choice.
Next time, get him.
Hey. What’s important right now?
(softens) That I just had my first reading?

Exactly. (beat) Now, I gotta head back to work. A certain Lil’ Wayne is waiting. It’s my first grill! Colin runs his finger over his upper teeth. JUST THEN - we hear a Marimba Chime. Trish and Colin both check their synchronized IPHONES. A PHONE APP WITH A PINK CALENDAR informs them -"“You_are now ovulating.” Trish gi Colin a hungry look -
Please? We’ll be super fast. Colin sighs, fine...
JARS OF NIPPLE CREAM rock on a shelf as Colin and Trish g it in a tiny stock room crammed with product. It’s not th best sex, but Trish is determined.
Yeah, give it to me... C’mon twins - or any number would be great!

Trish’s employee JANICE (20s, boho, probably breast fed u last week) hears the stockroom action and CRANKS THE VOLU on a SLEEP SHEEP, drowning them out with AMBIENT WAVES. 10 ll  12 13 14 10. INT. STOCK ROOM — DAY 12 A jar of nipple cream falls and nails Colin in the head.
Oh! Are you OK? Colin nods, but slows. The mood quickly fading... annnd g
Sorry, Squeaks, I just -
- No, don't apologize! Negative thoughts can affect reproduction.
But I’m really trying. I lost the weight, switched my underwear, quit riding my bike.
I know. And I love you for that!
I’m just not clutch. I don’t perform under pressure. (beat) And I miss... us.
(a little gasp) Oh no! We’re snuffing out the flame?
Maybe?... A little?...

Colin, headed back to work, steps onto the elevator as Na Bowen (our “guy’s-guy” husband) steps off. Nate’s look is business casual, cool kicks. He gives Colin a ‘What's up? nod as he exits. EXT. Shit shit shit. INT. NATE AND HOLLY’S HOUSE - DAY 15 Holly runs in the house, down the hall -
Sorry! We had a huge living room install and they kept changing the furniture placement. She opens the door to find her husband Nate in his home 1 office/ music studio. Tinkering on his KEYBOARD -

Just waitin’ on my lay-day/ Gonna get our Ethiopian bay-bay... She laughs as her gaze falls on a wall of FRAMED ALBUM CO - everything from classic jazz to rock to hip-hop. Her eyes zero in on 2 LIVE CREW’S classic, “Nasty As They Wanna Be.” Featuring a graphic photo of FOUR BARE-ASSED LADIES bending over. Holly yanks it off the wall -
Aw c’mon. That album represents a very important parenting milestone in my life. It was the first thing I bought just to piss off my mom.
They’re a Christian organization, Nate. I don’t want to offend them. Holly stuffs the graphic cover in a hall closet as she pa a MIRROR and spots her shoulder in her SLEEVELESS TOP.
Shit. My tattoo. Holly pulls off her shirt as she turns into -
Nate follows her, enjoying the view of his shirtless wife
So? You’re not gonna be the only mom out there with that Spring Break dolphin. Trust me.  19 12.

Yeah, but those moms aren’t getting judged like me. (changing shirts) The sad thing is, I wasn’t even drunk when I got this. I thought “Ooh, I’1l never get tired of dolphins.” She slips on a CONSERVATIVE SHIRT.
I haven't gotten tired of it. I smile every time I see it. He slaps her ass as she exits to -
Holly does a final zhush of the room - fluffing pillows, She grabs a FRAMED PHOTO off a side table, goes to hide i under the couch. But Nate intercepts it.
No. Not the wedding picture. It’s a classic.
I know, but it’s not for everyone.
Just chill, OK? You were meant to do this.
(under her breath) If that were true, I’d already be pregnant. The DOORBELL RINGS. They suddenly stop. Share a quick kis
Love you. Don’t screw it up. Nate goes to the door as Holly stuffs the wedding photo u the couch. The SOCIAL WORKER (40s, sweater set) greets Na
Hi there. I’m Diane Carter from Christian World Adoption.
Nate and Holly Bowen. Come on in.  13. She enters, they exchange polite handshakes as she looks around. The place is modest, but decorated with style.
This is just a rental. We’re looking to buy right now. Nate throws Holly a look - We are? Holly nods.
We’ll be settled in before the baby even comes.

Don’t worry. You’ve already passed the fingerprints and background check. This is just for us to get to know you better. 20 INT. NATE AND HOLLY’S HOUSE - HALLWAY - EVENING 20 Nate and Holly give the Social Worker the walk through.
..-And why did you choose Ethiopia?
Holly wanted to get back to her roots. The Social Worker laughs. Holly shoots Nate a look.
We love the culture, actually.

Plus all the white babies were taken. This Social Worker doesn’t laugh. Holly punches Nate. He recomposes, tries to act respectable as he points out - NATE (CONT’D) (in the bedroom) OK, so. Smoke detector there. (points to the kitchen) Fire extinguisher there.

Good. You did your homework.  21 14. Nate opens the door to his office/music room. The Social Worker peeks in, looks at all the old vinyl, mixing table etc. Past the wall of framed albums - with a gaping hole. SOCIAL WORKER (CONT’D) You’re a musician?
In my mind, yes. Actually, I do music licensing for an ad agency here in Atlanta.
He picks the songs for commercials. The Social Worker nods, jotting notes.
Holly’s an interior designer. She did this whole place.
I just got in with a big firm. It’s a huge opportunity to grow. The Social Worker nods, makes more notes.
INT. NATE AND HOLLY’S LIVING ROOM - LATER aa Nate and Holly sit on the couch across from the Social Wo as she finishes up their paperwork.
OK, so here’s how this works. I’11 turn in your home study report, the agency will review it, then start the adoption process. Including matching you with your child.
Right. The referral.
Exactly. And that can take up to six months. Then another six to nine months for the home country to process everything. Nate nods, paying close attention to the time line.  22 15.
So, we’re talking at least a full year before we become parents?
Every case has its own time line. You just have to be patient.
So, wait. Does this mean we passed? The Social Worker looks over their application packet.

Well, I don’t see any red flags. (then) Oh, but do you have a wedding picture? We really like to include that in your packet. Holly shakes her head, no. But Nate pulls the photo out f under the couch and hands it to the Social Worker. CLOSE ON: THE PHOTO - NATE AND HOLLY IN COSTUME, shit-fac with a bottle of Jack, and an ELVIS IMPERSONATOR OFFICIAN
Vegas. It was a costume wedding. I was Shaft, Holly was a showgirl. The picture is funny, but doesn’t scream parents of the y The Social Worker studies it a beat, then hands it back.

You know what? We’1ll just say this got lost. Burned in a fire. EXT. NATE AND HOLLY’S HOUSE - DOORWAY - NIGHT 22 Nate and Holly wave as the Social Worker drives away. Nat lets out a sigh, almost like he’s psyching himself up.
OK, so we've got a year. That gives us some time to save and get ready.
What do you mean? We’re ready now. Holly is. But Nate’s not so convinced as we PAN UP to the NIGHT SKY, and...  23 16.
It’s OUTDOOR MOVIE NIGHT in the lush park backed by the Atlanta skyline. Lots of date-night couples. Including Colin and Trish who lay out their blanket.

Bladerunner.

Ooh, another surprise. I love you even more. Colin kicks off his loafers as Trish pulls a bottle of WI from their ergonomic wine carrier and two glasses. Colin gives her a look as he pops the cork and pours.
Trish? You sure? You haven’t a had a glass in two years. Trish nods. This is not easy for her, but she smiles -
I'd like to propose a toast. To taking a break from trying and just... being us for a while.
(so relieved) OK. I’11 drink to that - He goes to clink glasses, but Trish pulls hers back.

- And if that doesn’t work, then we'll do three rounds of IVF. (then) And if that doesn’t work, we’1l adopt, which is great because I have no fears - genetic or otherwise! So, to us! (beat, tight smile) I don’t want to lose the flame.
To the flame. They clink and sip. Trish guzzles that first sip. Then -  24 Nh.

Say. Pinot Grigio is refreshing. As Colin scouts - A ROW OF NEARBY GOURMET FOOD TRUCKS. His eyes landing on “THE BIG PIG” - a pink truck with a snout and curly tail specializing in a menu of gourmet pork. An eager line is already waiting.
Ooh! The Big Pig is here! I didn’t even get a Tweet. (slipping on his loafers) Squeaks, you want anything?

The TRUCK WINDOW. Chef MARCO SUAREZ (23, a playful troublemaker with the looks to get away with it) works wi three-man CREW. A fast, furious, all-hands-on-deck operat

Marco looks over, his eyes narrowing. Then he JUMPS throu the window of his truck, abandoning his post. J.J. (20s), Marco's misfit co-worker, calls after him - J.d. Yo, Chef. Where’re you going?
Back in two secs, J.J.

Chef Rosie Brennen (from the girls’ apartment), effortles beautiful, her hair in braids, works on the Cheese Truck. She wields her knife with skill - slicing peaches and bac when suddenly Marco is at her window, staring her down.
What do you think you're doing? Rosie gives him a look. Then keeps chopping.
There’s a line if you want to order -
- The only thing I’m ordering is for you to stop serving that bacon. Pig is our turf.
Your “turf?” What is this, West Side Story? Are we gonna rumble at midnight?
Maybe. I got a whole gang of back-up dancers ready to go. (then) You're the cheese truck. Stick to that.
That’s funny, because I noticed those jalapeno fritters you’re serving -
- Are awesome, right? My invention -
- Have ricotta cheese in them.
Oh, c’mon, just a pinch. That’s nothing compared to the bacon crutch you’re propping these sandwiches up on.
Paninis. Blue cheese and grilled peach paninis - with a dash of bacon. Also awesome. My invention.
Fine. You wanna go? Let’s go. Your special against mine - whoever sells the most tonight, wins. (beat) If I win, you have to have a drink with me. And if you win, you may also have a drink with me.
Right. So you can stand me up again? I'll pass. 19. Marco stops, gives her a slow smile. Taunting, flirtaciou

It’s not like it keeps me up nights. Trust me.
(walking away) Good to see you too, Rosie.

You know that guy?

(watching Marco go) Yeah... I’d play with that. TIME LAPSE - as the lines move through the two trucks, th food teams work hard, putting out food.
An empty bottle of wine rolling on a blanket as Colin and Trish sort of watch the movie. Colin’s feeling good. He casually walks his hand up Trish skirt. She whispers, faux scandalized -
But, Dr. Cooper. We’re in public.

Rosie SLAMS the heavy back door of the idling cheese truc The truck pulls away to reveal - Marco on the other side - with TWO COLD BEERS and a smile
I win. His chef knives slung over his shoulder. The same ones Ro has slung over her shoulder. She sighs.

29 21. EXT. PIEDMONT PARKING LOT/ ROSIE’S SHITTY DODGE NEON - NI Rosie and Marco sit on the hood of her battered DODGE NEO his BIKE leaned against the car. The iPod on her dash provides the soundtrack to their conversation.
---It’s true. I had a mad crush on you back in the day.

My first Cog Au Vin. Five stitches.  30 22.
Five? That’s adorable. (then, shows another scar) Deli slicer. Nearly took my thumb.
(re: a scar on his arm) Second degree burn from a double- boiler. Making caramel.

(showing another scar) This one. Julienning shallots.
(showing another scar) Julianne. Ex-girlfriend.

So mean. Are you always this mean? She smiles and nods. Marco give her a look. A moment betw them. Rosie considers him, then lets out a decisive sigh.
OK, Trouble. I’m gonna go. She slides off the hood. Marco gives her a look, then hop off too. He makes a show of opening the car door for her.
Well, Rosie Brennen, it was good catching up. Maybe I’11 see ya on the truck line again sometime. Marco formally holds out his hand. Rosie shakes it.

If you‘re lucky. She lets go, turns to get in her car. But then, Rosie tur back to him and suddenly they’re KISSING. SMASH TO: Rosie and Marco making out against the car, all chemistry midnight madness. Talking between kisses -  31 32 33 23..
OK, seriously, I’m going... (more kissing) This is me getting in my car...

Trish and Colin tip-toe out of a wooded park area, wrappe their picnic blanket. He picks a leaf from her hair. Then
Is that our alarm? And from the blinking RED TAIL LIGHTS of Rosie’s car to:

They slip onto t face of Evan as his gaze focuses on Jules, already up and stretching. He watches her from bed, enjoying the view. She’s not showing yet, but her boobs look bigger. He smil

I just don’t want you to feel trapped. I really thought I had a bad fallopian tube. Honestly, if you don’t think you can handle it - that’s fine - let’s not force it. Evan reaches out and pulls Jules back to bed with him.

A lot.
So? We’re old enough, we love each other, we can afford it, what’s to figure out? He smiles, kisses her. Then -
Yeah, it’s not like it changes who we are.

New season starts in three weeks, and we’ll be wrapped before I have to deliver. (beat, smile) I’m gonna help people get thin while I get fat. Evan laughs. Jules gives him a last kiss, gets out of bed flashes her boobs one last time before heading to the bathroom.
A pristine 1920’s house in historic Little Five Points. Lots of character. A FOR SALE SIGN in the yard.  35 25.
Inside, wood floors, beautiful old windows - the kind of place you buy and live in forever. COUPLES linger, taking it in. Including Nate and Holly, w is already decorating it in her mind.
This is it. This is the one.
What?! No. We’re not buying. We’re just looking.
But can’t you picture it? The couch here, you and your keyboard over there, singing at our Christmas party. Nate mimes playing the keys as he makes up a goofy song -
Are you effin crazy?/ First, we gotta deal with the baby/ Then we can talk house, my lovely spouse - Holly starts defiantly singing her own song, Edward Sharp and the Magnetic Zero’s “Home.”
Home, let me come home home home -
- Oh no, uh-uh. You’re not allowed to use that song against me. I’m the one who put it on your iPod.
I know. It’s a good one.
Yeah. I’m trying to get it placed in our United Airlines ad. Holly nods, then catches another COUPLE seriously checkin out the house. She gives them a territorial stare.
Nate. This is the one.  36 37 26.
We're just looking.

I did it! I preggoed you! Trish and Colin jump up and down in the pool, hugging. Tr suddenly looks rather turned on, starts to make out with  40 28. s+ SHLts

Sorry. Coming. Rosie flushes, quickly stuffs the pregnancy evidence in a drawer and OPENS the door as her two roommates - Molly and Courtney stumble in. Molly grabs her purple bra from the curtain rod and slips it on under her shirt.
God, this is depressing. I worked at Urban Outfitters my senior year. Now I have to go crawling back. (beat) Thanks for nothing, college degree.
Olive Garden fell through, huh?
Aw, Molls. We were really looking forward to those free bread sticks.
Don’t worry. I still have that pervy manager at Outback who loves me. He’ll hook us up with free drinks and apps during happy hour.  41 42 29,.
Sounds like dinner. Rosie, you in?
Yeah. Because all my life needs right now is a free Mai Tai and some coconut shrimp. Rosie walks to her bedroom and shuts the door. Courtney a Molly share a look.
What the hell? I thought she finally got laid.
Colin and Trish stand at the DOOR of an imposing estate. Trish's breasts look like they’ve grown three cup sizes s the last scene. She helps psyche Colin up.
Don’t let him get into your head.

Not today. He can’t ruin this. Trish nods in solidarity, then THROWS UP in a BUSH. Colin makes a gross face, then gently rubs her back, as -— COLIN (PRE-LAP) (CONT’D) So, Dad, Trish and I have a little announcement to make...
TIGHT ON: Colin and Trish sitting at an outdoor table wit brunch. A lush back yard and pool behind them. Right on a pristine GOLF COURSE.

COLIN! Hey! Colin turns back and sees Ramsey riding his own golf cart trying to catch up. Colin calls back.

RAMSEY (CONT’D) Oh, don’t try to game me. You forget who you’re dealing with. And, at that moment - something IGNITES in Colin's mind - HE HEARS RACE CARS REVVING. Colin looks back, gives Ramse look.
